about.summary: A set of tools for processing and modeling high-throughput and high-content chemical screening data. The package was developed for the the chemical screening data generated by the US EPA ToxCast program, but can be used for diverse chemical screening efforts.

A set of tools for processing and modeling high-throughput and high-content chemical screening data. The package was developed for the the chemical screening data generated by the US EPA ToxCast program, but can be used for diverse chemical screening efforts.

name: r-tcpl

about.summary: A set of tools for processing and modeling high-throughput and high-content chemical screening data. The package was developed for the the chemical screening data generated by the US EPA ToxCast program, but can be used for diverse chemical screening efforts.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '2.0.2' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-tcpl
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/tcpl_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/tcpl/tcpl_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 6cad3ca8dcd5e4be9a751e1eeb938bbc44758af77132bef7ac5c358abc242c76

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dbi
    - r-rcolorbrewer
    - r-rmysql
    - r-data.table >=1.9.4
    - r-numderiv
    - r-sqldf
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dbi
    - r-rcolorbrewer
    - r-rmysql
    - r-data.table >=1.9.4
    - r-numderiv
    - r-sqldf

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('tcpl')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('tcpl')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/USEPA/CompTox-ToxCast-tcpl
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: A set of tools for processing and modeling high-throughput and high-content chemical
    screening data. The package was developed for the the chemical screening data generated
    by the US EPA ToxCast program, but can be used for diverse chemical screening efforts.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - mfakaehler

# Package: tcpl
# Title: ToxCast Data Analysis Pipeline
# Version: 2.0.2
# Authors@R: c( person("Richard S", "Judson",role = c("cre","ths"), email = "Judson.Richard@epa.gov"), person("Dayne L", "Filer", role = "aut",email = "dayne.filer@gmail.com"), person("Jason","Brown",role = "ctb", email = "brown.jason@epa.gov"), person("Todd", "Zurlinden", role="ctb", email="zurlinden.todd@epa.gov"), person("Parth", "Kothiya", role = "ctb"), person("Woodrow R", "Setzer", role = "ctb"), person("Matthew T", "Martin", role = c("ctb", "ths")), person("Katie", "Paul Friedman", role=c("ctb"), email = "paul-friedman.katie@epa.gov") )
# Description: A set of tools for processing and modeling high-throughput and high-content chemical screening data. The package was developed for the the chemical screening data generated by the US EPA ToxCast program, but can be used for diverse chemical screening efforts.
# URL: https://github.com/USEPA/CompTox-ToxCast-tcpl
# Depends: R (>= 3.2.0)
# Imports: data.table (>= 1.9.4), DBI, RMySQL, numDeriv, RColorBrewer, utils, stats, methods, graphics, grDevices, sqldf
# Suggests: roxygen2, knitr, prettydoc, rmarkdown, htmlTable
# License: GPL-2
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-07-26 13:41:17 UTC; jbrown20
# Author: Richard S Judson [cre, ths], Dayne L Filer [aut], Jason Brown [ctb], Todd Zurlinden [ctb], Parth Kothiya [ctb], Woodrow R Setzer [ctb], Matthew T Martin [ctb, ths], Katie Paul Friedman [ctb]
# Maintainer: Richard S Judson <Judson.Richard@epa.gov>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-07-26 14:50:02 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.3
